name: Unauthenticated Access to AWS S3 Bucket from Specific IP Ranges
description:
The ACME Company must adhere to specific regulations relevant to its industry.
You have been informed that auditors require access to historical financial records.
Given the limited resources and expertise available on both sides,
the most practical solution at this time is to grant access to these records through a public S3 bucket.
Fortunately, the auditors have indicated that they possess a static range of IP addresses,
which can be utilized to restrict access solely to them.

Please create an AWS **S3 bucket policy** that grants public access to the specific **trusted IP ranges** listed below:

  - *123.123.123.0/24*
  - *31.33.7.0/24*
hints: What is the purpose of the [Principal](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_policies_elements_principal.html) field?
You may find the answer to your challenge in the list of [AWS global condition context keys](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_policies_condition-keys.html)
